children.value:
A Big Mac has 
$\quantity{2.2}{MJ}$
 of chemical potential energy which can be released by eating it.

How much energy is needed to lift a 
$\quantity{50}{kg}$
 student upwards through a height of 
$\quantity{0.4}{m}$
?

How many step-ups of 
$\quantity{0.4}{m}$
 would the student need to make in order to burn off the energy of a Big Mac?

How many Big Macs would he need to consume in order to reach the top of Mount Everest, a height of 
$\quantity{8}{km}$
?

If the energy of a Big Mac could be used by itself to propel itself upwards, how high could it rise? (The mass of a Big Mac is 
$\quantity{0.22}{kg}$
.)
